title: World-Wide
text:
Federal regulators lifted restrictions on visits to nursing homes, after widespread vaccination helped sharply reduce Covid-19 cases and deaths among residents.

Biden directed his administration to secure an additional 100 million doses of J&J's Covid-19 vaccine by year-end and said he planned to share any excess vaccine supply with other nations.

Brazil has overtaken the U.S. as the country with the most daily Covid-19 cases and deaths in the world.

---

The Senate confirmed Garland as attorney general in a 70-30 vote, putting a respected jurist in charge of the Justice Department.

---

The number of unaccompanied children crossing the border illegally rose 63% to 9,297 in February, U.S. Customs and Border Protection said.

---

Top U.S. and Chinese officials are set to hold talks next week in the first high-level in-person meeting between the two powers since Biden took office.

---

South Korea will pay the U.S. more than $7 billion over six years against the cost of maintaining American troops on the Korean Peninsula.
